A mother says her 13-year-old son was attacked by children from another school after being lured into a fight over Snapchat. 
The youngster suffered a fractured cheekbone, bloody nose and cuts and bruising to his face when he was set upon by a gang of up 20 children, according to his shocked family. 
His iPhone 6, Armani bag and cash were also stolen during the attack. 
Police are now investigating the assault in a field beside Abraham Moss Community School in Crumpsall just after home time. Read More 
His mum says her son, a pupil at Prestwich Arts College, was ‘lured into a trap’ by an Abraham Moss student he didn’t know through Snapchat, a picture sharing app. 
The M.E.N. has contacted both schools for a comment. The victim of the attack is a pupil at Prestwich Arts College 
The victim’s boy’s mother and she said: “I’m shocked and horrified by what happened to him. We’re so lucky to still have him alive. The doctors have said its lucky no damage was caused to his brain.” Read More Fraudster who plundered bank accounts of David Silva and Manuel Pellegrini was caught after ex-City boss had card declined at restaurant 
Her son was discharged from North Manchester General Hospital at 1am on the day after the January 24 incident. 
The mother continued: “He was randomly picked out on social media by a boy at another school who wanted to fight him. This went round Prestwich Arts College like wildfire. His mum says he was attacked after being lured into a field next to Abraham Moss Community School, in Crumpsall 
"Naively, he agreed to meet him at the tram station just to ask him why, not to fight, and he was was taken to a field right next to the school. Read More Gemma Atkinson left squirming after being asked if she's been dating a footballer 
“The lad went to punch him and my son defended himself. Someone then came from the crowd and kicked him in the back of the knee and he fell to the floor. 
"More than 20 pupils all dressed in uniform then attacked him, kicking my son and stamping on his head over and over again. He’s got a hairline fracture of the cheekbone. He has a stamp mark from a heel on his face. Snapchat is a picture message exchanging app, used mainly by teenagers 
“I don’t know why they attacked my son.” she said. 
“I’m appealing to the public for help to catch who did this to my son. I want the school to do something about this as this is a massive safeguarding issue,” she added. Read More Teenager arrested after being caught carrying 10-inch knife at Victoria station 
A spokesman for Greater Manchester Police said: “Shortly before 4.10pm on Tuesday, January 24, police were called to Crescent Road, Crumpsall, to reports of an assault. A 13-year-old boy was involved in a physical altercation and suffered injuries to his head.” 
Anyone with information is asked to contact police on 101 and quote the reference number 1330 of 24/01/17, or Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. 
The M.E.N. has contacted both schools for a comment. Like us on Facebook
